required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-authorisation Passive Enhanced Safety Surveillance of Seasonal Influenza Vaccines
clinical_study.official_title: Post-authorisation Passive Enhanced Safety Surveillance of Seasonal Influenza Vaccines: Pilot Study in England

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this 2016/17 pilot study is to improve the combination of a card-based adverse drug reaction (ADR) system and the use of routine data to collect adverse events following vaccination with seasonal influenza vaccines, as per European Medicines Agency (EMA) guidance and Pharmacovigilance Risk Assessment Committee of EMA (PRAC) requirements, and to identify additional data which may need to be collected in order to appropriately address the requirement.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and onset dates of AEIs reported using a card based ADR reporting system in vaccinated patients overall
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days post vaccination (anticipated to be between 01 September 2016 and 30 November 2016)
primary_outcome.description: AEIs will be presented by categories depending of the nature of the event. E.g., - Fever or other febrile illness; - Local reactions; - General reaction (e.g., fatigue, myalgia, etc.).

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and onset dates of AEIs reported using a card based ADR reporting system in vaccinated patients by brand
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days post vaccination (anticipated to be between 01 September 2016 and 30 November 2016)
primary_outcome.description: AEIs will be presented by categories depending of the nature of the event. E.g., - Fever or other febrile illness; - Local reactions; - General reaction (e.g., fatigue, myalgia, etc.).

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and onset dates of AEIs reported using a card based ADR reporting system in vaccinated patients by age strata (6 months to 5 years; 6 to 12 years; 13 to 18 years; ≥18-65 years; >65)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days post vaccination (anticipated to be between 01 September 2016 and 30 November 2016)
primary_outcome.description: AEIs will be presented by categories depending of the nature of the event. E.g., - Fever or other febrile illness; - Local reactions; - General reaction (e.g., fatigue, myalgia, etc.).

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and onset dates of AEIs reported using a card based ADR reporting system in vaccinated patients by CMO-specified risk groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days post vaccination (anticipated to be between 01 September 2016 and 30 November 2016)
primary_outcome.description: AEIs will be presented by categories depending of the nature of the event. E.g., - Fever or other febrile illness; - Local reactions; - General reaction (e.g., fatigue, myalgia, etc.).

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and onset dates of AEIs reported using the EHR in vaccinated patients by age strata
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days post vaccination (anticipated to be between 01 September 2016 and 30 November 2016)
secondary_outcome.description: AEIs will be presented by categories depending of the nature of the event. - Fever or other febrile illness; - Local reaction; - General reaction (fatigue, myalgia, etc.); - All other presentations that have been reported following vaccination (e.g., Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barre syndrome).

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and onset dates of AEIs reported using the EHR in vaccinated patients by CMO-specified risk groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 7 days post vaccination (anticipated to be between 01 September 2016 and 30 November 2016)
secondary_outcome.description: AEIs will be presented by categories depending of the nature of the event. - Fever or other febrile illness; - Local reaction; - General reaction (fatigue, myalgia, etc.); - All other presentations that have been reported following vaccination (e.g., Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barre syndrome).

arm_group.description: Volunteered subjects who will receive influenza vaccination in approximately 10 volunteer practices.

intervention.description: Extraction of routinely collected primary care data from approximately 10 volunteer English general practices by using an improved card-based ADR reporting system to estimate proportions of AEIs among seasonal influenza-vaccinated individuals.

study_pop.textblock: Registered patients in up to 10 volunteer English general practices immunized against seasonal influenza at the beginning of 2016/17 season.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• Volunteers receiving an influenza vaccine and receiving an ADR card at the beginning of the 2016/17 season.
Exclusion Criteria:
• In the database analysis, registered patients who have explicitly opted out of data sharing will be excluded from the analysis.
